title: Ophiuchus

nouns: A large constellation in the equatorial region between Hercules and Scorpius
Ophiuchus is a large constellation located around the celestial equator.
A zodiacal constellation of the northern summer said to depict a man (Asclepius) holding a serpent; the serpent is the constellation Serpens.
One of the 88 constellations and was also one of the 48 listed by Ptolemy.
Former name for a zodiacal constellation of the northern summer said to depict a man holding a serpent; the serpent is the constellation Serpens.
Zodiacal constellation of the northern summer.

description: Ophiuchus is used by some as a 13th sign in the Zodiac. The symbol for ophiuchus appears a U shape with a wavy line through it.
apple_vendor_description: The Ophiuchus emoji on Apple devices presents a stylized figure entwined with a serpent, rendered in a dynamic pose with Apple's characteristic smooth gradients and soft, rounded forms.  The celestial design incorporates subtle highlights, suggesting a deep, mystical significance.  This emoji, with its unique and detailed artwork on Apple devices, represents the mysterious 13th sign of the zodiac and is often used in discussions related to astrology, fate, or the unconventional.
